title: Phoenix, Arizona
summary: Phoenix (/ˈfiːnɪks/ FEE-niks; Navajo: Hoozdo; Spanish: Fénix or Fínix) is the capital and most populous city in Arizona, with 1,608,139 residents as of 2020.[4] It is also the fifth-most populous city in the United States, the largest state capital by population,[5] and the only state capital with a population of more than one million residents.[6][7]
